answers.answer: Some stay in hospital if they have high risk pregnancys an put on strict bedrest until there duedate  some have c sections if baby is to big or if they have history of csections an if they aren't able to have vaginal delivery they go into emergency csection.
I had csection just because I couldn't dilate... I was induced though...a lot of women who get induced don't dilate and end up having csection
I have to have a c section next week since my lil girl is breech and they can't turn her...:(

My first was a csection because my pelvic bone is not aligned right and I could break it trying to push a baby out, my second was a repeat csection for the same reason and plus he was breech, and I will be having another csection this time my sister had to have an emergency csection because of my nephew coming butt first and there are a few reasons why a pregnant woman would have to be in the hospital preecla
Preeclampsia, dehydration, bleeding, anything that could risk the health of the mother or baby

Well when I had my daughter I had an emergency c section because I wasn't dilating, I didn't want to risk going vaginally so I'm doing a second c section. I had to stay 4 days in the hospital because my incision was not healing right :)
I agree with @diaz02 because that exactly what happen to me :)

question: Why do some pregnant mommies have a c-section & why do some have to stay in the hospital during there whole pregnancy ?
title: c-section
